## Help Wanted! Contributors Welcome ðŸš€

We're looking for contributors to help improve the Battery Monitor application! This issue represents an area where the project could use assistance.

### Description
This is a general help wanted issue for contributors to pick up. There are many ways to contribute to the project, and we're flexible about the type of contribution.

### Suggested Areas of Contribution
- **Bug fixes**: Look through existing issues labeled `bug`
- **Code refactoring**: Improve code quality and maintainability
- **UI/UX enhancements**: Improve the web interface and user experience
- **Documentation**: Improve README, code comments, or create new documentation
- **Testing**: Add unit tests or improve test coverage
- **Feature development**: Implement new functionality based on user requests
- **Performance improvements**: Optimize existing code

### Getting Started
1. Read our [CONTRIBUTING.md](../blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) guidelines
2. Fork the repository
3. Create a feature branch for your changes
4. Submit a pull request when ready

### For Beginners
Issues labeled `good first issue` are perfect for newcomers to the project. These are typically well-defined tasks that don't require deep knowledge of the entire codebase.

### Communication
- Feel free to ask questions in this issue if you need clarification
- Check out the [README](../blob/main/README.md) for project overview and setup instructions
- Join the discussion in other related issues

### Why Contribute?
- Improve an open-source project used by many
- Gain experience with Python, Flask, and system monitoring
- Contribute to a project that helps users maintain battery health
- Build your open-source portfolio

We appreciate all contributions, big or small!
